whitebox.geospatialfiles

Class WhiteboxRaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • whitebox.geospatialfiles.WhiteboxRasterBase
      • whitebox.geospatialfiles.WhiteboxRaster

  • public class WhiteboxRaster
extends WhiteboxRasterBase
    The whiteboxRaster is used to manipulate Whitebox GAT raster files (.dep and .tas).

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class whitebox.geospatialfiles.WhiteboxRasterBase

        WhiteboxRasterBase.DataScale, WhiteboxRasterBase.DataType

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean isReflectedAtEdges
      Set to true when the getValue function should reflect beyond the edges.
      boolean isTemporaryFile
      Set to false if the header and data files (.dep and .tas) should be deleted when the object is closed.

    • Field Detail

      • isTemporaryFile

        public boolean isTemporaryFile
        Set to false if the header and data files (.dep and .tas) should be deleted when the object is closed.

      • isReflectedAtEdges

        public boolean isReflectedAtEdges
        Set to true when the getValue function should reflect beyond the edges.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WhiteboxRaster

        public WhiteboxRaster(java.lang.String HeaderFile,
                      java.lang.String FileAccess)
        Class constructor. Notice that the data file name will also be set based on the specified header file name.
        Parameters:
        HeaderFile - The name of the WhiteboxRaster header file.
        FileAccess - Sets the file access. Either "r" (read-only) or "rw" (read/write).

      • WhiteboxRaster

        public WhiteboxRaster(java.lang.String HeaderFile,
                      java.lang.String FileAccess,
                      double BufferSize)
        Class constructor. Notice that the data file name will also be set based on the specified header file name.
        Parameters:
        HeaderFile - The name of the WhiteboxRaster header file.
        FileAccess - Sets the file access. Either "r" (read-only) or "rw" (read/write).
        BufferSize - Determines the how much data can be stored in memory.

      • WhiteboxRaster

        public WhiteboxRaster(java.lang.String HeaderFile,
                      java.lang.String FileAccess,
                      java.lang.String BaseRasterHeader,
                      WhiteboxRasterBase.DataType dataType,
                      double InitialValue)
        Class constructor. Notice that the data file name will also be set based on the specified header file name.
        Parameters:
        HeaderFile - The name of the WhiteboxRaster header file.
        FileAccess - Sets the file access. Either "r" (read-only) or "rw" (read/write).
        BaseRasterHeader - The name of a WhiteboxRaster header file to base this new object on.
        dataType - The data type of the new WhiteboxRaster. Can be 'double', 'float', 'integer', or 'byte'
        InitialValue - Double indicating the value used to initialize the grid. It is recommended to use the noDataValue.

      • WhiteboxRaster

        public WhiteboxRaster(java.lang.String HeaderFile,
                      java.lang.String FileAccess,
                      java.lang.String BaseRasterHeader,
                      WhiteboxRasterBase.DataType dataType,
                      double InitialValue,
                      double BufferSize)
        Class constructor. Notice that the data file name will also be set based on the specified header file name.
        Parameters:
        HeaderFile - The name of the WhiteboxRaster header file.
        FileAccess - Sets the file access. Either "r" (read-only) or "rw" (read/write).
        BaseRasterHeader - The name of a WhiteboxRaster header file to base this new object on.
        dataType - The data type of the new WhiteboxRaster. Can be 'double', 'float', 'integer', or 'byte'
        InitialValue - Double indicating the value used to initialize the grid. It is recommended to use the noDataValue.
        BufferSize - Determines how much data can be stored in memory.

        Returns:
        long stating the number of reads.

      • getNumberOfDataFileWrites

        public long getNumberOfDataFileWrites()
        The number of times that the data file (.tas) has been written by this object.
        Returns:
        long stating the number of reads.

      • setRowValues

        public void setRowValues(int row,
                         double[] vals)
        This method should be used when you need to set an entire row of data at a time. It has less overhead that the setValue method (which works on a pixel-by-pixel basis) and can be used to efficiently scan through a raster image row by row.
        Parameters:
        row - An int stating the zero-based row to be returned.
        vals - An array of doubles containing the values store in the specified row.

      • getValue

        public double getValue(int row,
                       int column)
        Retrieves the value contained at a specified cell in the raster grid.
        Parameters:
        row - The zero-based row number.
        column - The zero-based column number.
        Returns:
        The value contained in the raster grid at the specified grid cell.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int row,
                     int column,
                     double value)
        Sets the value of a specified cell in the raster grid.
        Parameters:
        row - The zero-based row number.
        column - The zero-based column number.
        value - The value to place in the grid cell.

        public void incrementValue(int row,
                           int column,
                           double value)
        Increments the value of a specified cell in the raster grid.
        Parameters:
        row - The zero-based row number.
        column - The zero-based column number.
        value - The value to increment the grid cell by.
